stream_context.summary: Kaze hosts a YouTube stream focused on high-level planning for Course 11 (Frantic Fleet Factory) and the remaining slots of Overworld 3. The Bowser boss fight logic is finished, and the team is brainstorming five fresh course themes, retro-pipe assignments, and set-pieces while waiting for Zeina’s animations.

development_findings.summary: Bowser boss fight logic is complete; implementation of SFX/VFX is blocked until Zeina delivers final animations.
development_findings.quote: The Bowser fight is basically finished … but we are waiting for Zeina's animation first before I implement all that.

development_findings.summary: Course 11 is officially titled “Frantic Fleet Factory,” a Bowser air-ship factory where helmeted enemies can’t be jump-killed, a Wiggler overseer tracks sabotage, and set-pieces include cranes, scaffolding and a half-demolishable building.
Kaze discarded several early course ideas (computer level, ice-cream train, PayPal/mall) for being derivative or weak, emphasizing the need for new concepts.
development_findings.quote: We were planning 15 courses at the beginning of the development and a lot of the courses kinda suck. So we are going with new ideas.

development_findings.summary: Target structure: brainstorm 12–15 ideas, then choose the best 5–7 to fill the remaining eight level slots, reinforcing an iterative selection philosophy.
development_findings.quote: The way I see designing a game to be, you should come up with 15 ideas and use 5 of them.

development_findings.summary: New course themes tentatively locked: 1) Frantic Fleet Factory, 2) Wild West Valley (detective gameplay vs. Yoshi/Shy-Guy outlaws), 3) Super-hero comic city with mirror/haunted raven world, 4) Oversized Casino, 5) Music level (Mario Paint-inspired).

Retro-pipe assignments decided: Smash 64 'Board the Platforms' (Factory), Paper Mario 64 (West), Mario Land 1 (Comic City), Dr. Mario pill gauntlet (Casino), Mario Paint Composer sandbox (Music level).
Performance milestone: even complex levels now stay above 30 FPS on real N64 hardware in widescreen, making Kaze’s new 20 FPS interpolation hard to showcase.
development_findings.quote: I can’t even get below 30 FPS … the performance here is just way too good.

development_findings.summary: Factory enemies will wear helmets to justify immunity to stomps; dialogue will explain this to players.
Factory star concepts include causing a worker strike, toppling a Bowser statue with a crane, a strike-breaker boss fight, and demolishing material piles made of breakable Odyssey-style blocks.
Kaze will only build NTSC versions; no PAL/Region Free builds planned.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: generating many ideas and making good decisions is more valuable than raw asset production.
context_findings.quote: No matter how hard you work, if you don't make good decisions, your game's gonna be shit.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values simple, easily understood mechanics over overly complex or 'too far-out' concepts.
context_findings.quote: The thing about games is, it's good to have a complex game as long as it's easy to understand.

context_findings.summary: He moved streaming from Twitch to YouTube due to excessive ads and revenue split concerns.
context_findings.quote: Yeah, I'm streaming on YouTube now … I hate Twitch, so many ads.

context_findings.summary: Personal stance on monetization: prefers free, accessible hacks over paywalls or ads.
context_findings.quote: I don't want people to have to pay or watch ads for games; I just want to make good games.

context_findings.summary: Expressed excitement when a breakthrough idea lands (e.g., Wild West detective angle) and frustration when chat recycles unsuitable suggestions.

biobak.summary: Kaze jokes about not wanting to dump 200 hours of unpaid workload on Biobak when chat suggests ambitious art styles.
biobak.quote: Biobak could do the work for me. I'm not just gonna ask Biobak, 'Hey, do 200 hours of unpaid labor,' thank you.

badub.summary: Music level will require coordination with Badub; Kaze anticipates extra complexity but believes it is feasible.
badub.quote: It's gonna be difficult to organize this with Badub, but I think it should work.

zeina.summary: Zeina is preparing Bowser fight animations; her delivery gates the final SFX/VFX pass and official completion of two overworlds.
zeina.quote: We're now waiting for the animations Zeina's making, then we're doing the VFX and SFX.

key_stories.title: Overworld 3 Idea Crunch
key_stories.summary: Kaze realizes existing course list is weak and leads chat through an intensive brainstorm to fill the last five slots with stronger concepts.
key_stories.challenge: Many original level themes felt derivative or uninteresting.
key_stories.process: Discarded weak ideas, evaluated chat suggestions against design criteria, and drafted five fresh, higher-quality themes with retro-pipe matches.
key_stories.outcome: A provisional lineup for Overworld 3 was finalized, giving the team clear direction for upcoming production.
key_stories.key_quote: You need more ideas so you can discard the bad ones, right?

key_stories.title: Unexpected Performance Victory
key_stories.summary: While testing on real N64 hardware, Kaze finds that recent optimizations keep complex levels above 30 FPS even in widescreen.
key_stories.challenge: He wanted to demonstrate a new 20 FPS interpolation technique.
key_stories.process: Loaded demanding levels on hardware, attempting to force a slowdown.
key_stories.outcome: Could not dip below 30 FPS, demonstrating substantial engine gains and prompting new performance confidence.
key_stories.key_quote: I remember when people said the N64 couldn’t run this. Now I can’t even get below 30 FPS.

open_questions.context: Kaze floated a low-gravity haunted raven variant accessed via mirrors but hasn’t detailed technical implementation or narrative integration.
questions: How will the mirror transition be coded and optimized on N64?
What specific gameplay differences justify visiting both versions?
How will the art team visualize two states within memory limits?

open_questions.context: Final boss logic is done but awaits Zeina’s animations and subsequent VFX/SFX pass.
questions: What is Zeina’s animation workflow and timeline?
How will the new animations influence hitboxes and code?
What sound design is planned once visuals are in?

open_questions.context: Kaze proposes a Mario Paint composer sandbox but admits it may be hard to coordinate with Badub.
questions: How will the interactive note blocks be implemented technically?
What role will Badub play—original compositions, adaptive music, or both?
How will player-generated noise be mixed to avoid cacophony?

open_questions.context: Kaze achieved unexpected 30 FPS stability but hasn’t explained the specific optimizations or limits.
questions: Which engine changes yielded the biggest gains?
Are there remaining bottlenecks for larger, more dynamic levels?
How does the new 20 FPS interpolation work internally?

open_questions.context: A pill-drop gauntlet idea was chosen, but mechanics and camera issues remain unresolved.
questions: How will visibility issues be handled when pills fall from above?
Will timing be random or player-controlled?
What art assets and color palettes will be used to ensure instant recognizability?
